medical_history.chief_complaint: Growth retardation due to growth hormone and insulin-like growth factor I insensitivity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born after an uncomplicated pregnancy with a normal length and weight. At 2 months, he began experiencing multiple bacterial infections. His growth length standardized deviation scores (SDS) gradually decreased from -1.0 to -2.0 during the first year and rapidly to -4.1 by age 2.4 years. Growth failure became more pronounced over time, leading to dependence on nasogastric hyperalimentation. Following an allogeneic stem cell transplantation at age 2.4 years, there was a temporary improvement in height SDS until neurological deterioration occurred.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a heterozygous mutation of the IKBKG gene leading to GH and IGF-I resistance, ectodermal dysplasia, immunodeficiency, and severe growth failure.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father has mosaicism for the I/H9260B/H9251 mutation, which is associated with mild short stature and previous systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis. The mother is healthy and has had another healthy child.
